intro: Seseli pumilum, commonly known as dwarf seseli, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It is often found in open, sunny habitats at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
